"'NASA for all.' That's something that I think is really important because we are the universe, right? We are made of star stuff."

Celebrate #Pride and learn how Rebecca Sirmons helps tell the story of the universe as NASA TV's executive producer: http://go.nasa.gov/3IVxzj7

Ad astra per aspera 

Join us this #MemorialDay in remembering and honoring all those who made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our country.

LIVE: Listen as we discuss the science aboard the next @SpaceX cargo mission set for Saturday, June 3, sending solar arrays, small satellites, and a plant experiment to the @Space_Station. Tag questions #AskNASA.

"Congratulations on an outstanding mission."

The crew of the @Space_Station shared their thanks and farewells after Axiom Mission 2 undocked from the orbiting lab at 11:05am ET (1505 UTC). #Ax2 is scheduled to splash down off the coast of Florida tonight: https://go.nasa.gov/3MK1kUW

LIVE: The Axiom Mission 2 crew is heading home in @SpaceX's Dragon Freedom spacecraft after wrapping up the second all-private astronaut mission to the @Space_Station. #Ax2 undocking is scheduled for 11:05am ET (1505 UTC).

LIVE: After more than a week of science, outreach, and on-orbit activities, the all-private astronaut crew of #Ax2 is boarding their @SpaceX Dragon Freedom spacecraft to return to Earth. Hatch closure is scheduled for 9:10am ET (1310 UTC): http://nasa.gov/live

After just over a week in space, @Axiom_Space's #Ax2 astronauts are set to return to Earth on Tuesday, May 30. Here’s how to watch live coverage, from closing of the hatches to splashdown: https://go.nasa.gov/43vWzp6

Two @NASA_Astronauts will do a pair of spacewalks on June 9 and June 15 to install new solar arrays on the @Space_Station. We’ll stream them live.
 
Join us for a preview on June 1: https://go.nasa.gov/3MGCCFj

We completed a joint checkpoint review with @BoeingSpace ahead of the first #Starliner flight to carry astronauts, set for no earlier than July 21. Teams will provide updates leading up to the inaugural Crew Flight Test to and from the @Space_Station: https://go.nasa.gov/3MZR1xG

Hot new bombshells enter the villa.

Otherwise invisible to the unaided eye, infrared data from @NASAWebb and x-ray data from @ChandraXray make details in these proper fit cosmic wonders available by mapping the data to colors that humans can perceive:
https://go.nasa.gov/43wTsx9

We can’t imagine a more beautiful thing than May’s full moon – the Corn Moon. 

Set to peak on May 5 at 1:34pm ET (1634 UTC ), this full moon, also known as the Flower Moon, will appear full till Sunday. Discover how it got its names: http://go.nasa.gov/3piIAUs
Four of Uranus’ largest moons—Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, and Oberon—may have oceans beneath their icy crusts, according to a re-analysis of Voyager 2 data. https://go.nasa.gov/3VQtF0l

It’s a TRAP(PIST)-1! 

About 40 light-years away lies a planetary system with the most Earth-sized exoplanets found in a star's habitable zone. Learn more about the TRAPPIST-1 system that was recently studied by 
@NASAWebb
: http://go.nasa.gov/415DmsC

#MayTheFourth

When we say “supermassive black holes,” just how do they measure up? 

Using their shadows for size, we’ve rounded up 10 black holes and compared them to objects in our solar system. Don’t worry – these black holes are many light-years away: https://go.nasa.gov/3HIcDeW #BlackHoleWeek

The eta Aquariid meteor shower is expected to reach its peak tonight (May 4-5)—and even with the full Moon, it could still be a great night for skywatching!

Here's how, where and when to track the eta Aquariids: https://go.nasa.gov/42iqGQk

Today we mourn the passing of Samuel Durrance, an astronomer who flew aboard two @NASA Space Shuttle missions as a payload specialist and operated a collection of four telescopes as part of the Astro-1 and Astro-2 Spacelabs. Godspeed, Samuel.

Join us tomorrow from the @Space_Station!

With #Crew6 aboard, @SpaceX's Dragon Endeavour spacecraft is undocking and moving to a new port to make room for an upcoming cargo launch. Watch here and at http://nasa.gov/live starting at 7am ET (1100 UTC) on Saturday, May 6.

It’s a TRAP(PIST)-1! 

About 40 light-years away lies a planetary system with the most Earth-sized exoplanets found in a star's habitable zone. Learn more about the TRAPPIST-1 system that was recently studied by @NASAWebb: http://go.nasa.gov/415DmsC

#MayTheFourth
LIVE: Preview the next spacewalk set for Friday, April 28. Veteran astronaut Steve Bowen and first-time spacewalker @Astro_Alneyadi will prepare the @Space_Station for solar power upgrades.

NOW: @NASAEarth and @CenterForAstro scientists are answering questions on Reddit about TEMPO, a new space-based instrument that will revolutionize our understanding of air quality.
 
Want to learn more? Ask your own Qs on our AMA.

Earth is our home. 

On #EarthDay and every day, we’re learning more about our world and how it’s changing – giving us a deeper appreciation for the planet we call home.

Celebrate with us: https://go.nasa.gov/3mZmeXx
Wow! Look at all this love for Earth!  While you’re here, check out how we study Earth every day at @nasa.
